member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.Bindings.BrokeredMessageArgumentBinding.MessageValueBinder.SetValueAsync(System.Object,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Sends a BrokeredMessage to the bound queue.
member.param: BrokeredMessage instance as retrieved from user's WebJobs method argument.
member.remarks:
The out message parameter is processed as follows:
If the value is , no message will be sent.
If the value has empty content, a message with empty content will be sent.
If the value has non-empty content, a message with that content will be sent.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.Bindings.ByteArrayArgumentBindingProvider.ByteArrayArgumentBinding.BindAsync(Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.Bindings.ServiceBusEntity,Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Host.Bindings.ValueBindingContext)
member.remarks:
The out byte array parameter is processed as follows:
If the value is , no message will be sent.
If the value is an empty byte array, a message with empty content will be sent.
If the value is a non-empty byte array, a message with that content will be sent.

member.remarks:
The out string parameter is processed as follows:
If the value is , no message will be sent.
If the value is an empty string, a message with empty content will be sent.
If the value is a non-empty string, a message with that content will be sent.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.EventHubConfiguration.LeaseContainerName
member.summary: Name of the blob container that the EventHostProcessor instances uses to coordinate load balancing listening on an event hub. Each event hub gets its own blob prefix within the container.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.EventHubConfiguration.#ctor
member.summary: default constructor. Callers can reference this without having any assembly references to service bus assemblies.

member.summary: Constructs a new instance.
member.param: The optional to use when receiving events.
Optional to use to configure any EventProcessorHosts.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.EventHubConfiguration.BatchCheckpointFrequency
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of batches to process before creating an EventHub cursor checkpoint. Default 1.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.EventHubConfiguration.AddEventHubClient(Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.EventHubClient)
member.summary: Add an existing client for sending messages to an event hub. Infer the eventHub name from client.path

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.EventHubConfiguration.AddEventHubClient(System.String,Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.EventHubClient)
member.summary: Add an existing client for sending messages to an event hub. Infer the eventHub name from client.path

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.EventHubConfiguration.AddSender(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Add a connection for sending messages to an event hub. Connect via the connection string.
member.param: connection string for sending messages. If this includes an EntityPath, it takes precedence over the eventHubName parameter.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.EventHubConfiguration.AddEventProcessorHost(System.String,Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.EventProcessorHost)
member.summary: Add a connection for listening on events from an event hub.
member.remarks: The EventProcessorHost type is from the ServiceBus SDK. Allow callers to bind to EventHubConfiguration without needing to have a direct assembly reference to the ServiceBus SDK. The compiler needs to resolve all types in all overloads, so give methods that use the ServiceBus SDK types unique non-overloaded names to avoid eager compiler resolution.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.EventHubConfiguration.AddReceiver(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Add a connection for listening on events from an event hub. Connect via the connection string and use the SDK's built-in storage account.
member.param: connection string for receiving messages. This can encapsulate other service bus properties like the namespace and endpoints.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.EventHubConfiguration.AddReceiver(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Add a connection for listening on events from an event hub. Connect via the connection string and use the supplied storage account
member.param: storage connection string that the EventProcessorHost client will use to coordinate multiple listener instances.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBus.EventHubConfiguration.GetBlobPrefix(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get the blob prefix used with EventProcessorHost for a given event hub.
member.param: the event hub's service bus namespace.
member.returns: a blob prefix path that can be passed to EventProcessorHost.
member.remarks: An event hub is defined by it's path and namespace. The namespace is extracted from the connection string. This must be an injective one-to-one function because: 1. multiple machines listening on the same event hub must use the same blob prefix. This means it must be deterministic. 2. different event hubs must not resolve to the same path.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBusAccountAttribute
member.summary: Attribute used to override the default ServiceBus account used by triggers and binders.
member.remarks: This attribute can be applied at the parameter/method/class level, and the precedence is in that order.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.ServiceBusAccountAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a new instance.
member.param: A string value indicating the Service Bus connection string to use. This string should be in one of the following formats. These checks will be applied in order and the first match wins. - The name of an "AzureWebJobs" prefixed app setting or connection string name. E.g., if your setting name is "AzureWebJobsMyServiceBus", you can specify "MyServiceBus" here. - Can be a string containing %% values (e.g. %StagingServiceBus%). The value provided will be passed to any INameResolver registered on the JobHostConfiguration to resolve the actual setting name to use. - Can be an app setting or connection string name of your choosing.

member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the app setting that contains the Service Bus connection string.

member.summary: Gets or sets the app setting name that contains the Service Bus connection string.
